paragraphs.text: The buzz on the internet surrounding the new Star Wars trailer is showing that the franchise is assuredly a force to outmatch cat videos or even Kim Kardashian
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's almost four decades since George Lucas redefined blockbuster cinema with the original Star Wars - and despite his own attempts to undermine his legacy with a trio of poorly conceived prequels- the juggernaut shows no sign of slowing down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Revitalised under the helm of JJ Abrams (Lost, the Star Trek reboots) and in the hands of Disney, the new movie is building its hype very early indeed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The teaser trailer hit our screens a full year before the movie itself is scheduled to be released
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This triggered everything from frame by frame breakdowns by respectable newspapers, to a deluge of parodies
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: (the Lego version is a favourite
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the George Lucas version will appeal to geeks)
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Even the Middle East's favourite home-grown parody site, the Pan Arabia Enquirer, got in the action, deftly skewering the Facebook updates and tweets from UAE residents adamant that the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi commanded the starring role in the new teaser
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: So heaven knows what they'd make of an entire column on the subject
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because the thing is, the franchise has always had a long, if not entirely comfortable, relationship with the Middle East
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the first movie, scenes taking place on the desert world, Tatooine, were famously shot in Tunisia
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the fictional planet is even named after the Tunisian city of Tatouine as homage
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: By all accounts, the shoot there was difficult, with unseasonal rainstorms slowing production and sandstorms blitzing the complicated props
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Still that didn't stop the director from returning in 1997 to film scenes from the first prequel there
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the props and sets left behind from both shoots remain a tourist draw to this day
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not much better were the scavenging, hustling Jawas, piloting a giant slave ship for robots around the dunes; or the Mos Eisley Cantina, a bar drawn straight from the malaria-fevered imaginations of an old colonial soak returned from some mythical Kasbah in the mystical Orient
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Far more troubling, though, was the repulsive Watto from the disappointing prequel, "The Phantom Menace"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A slave-owning, money-obsessed trader, Watto has the singular honour of being roundly criticised as both an anti-Arab and an anti-Jewish stereotype
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Patricia J Williams, writing in the The Nation said simply that the character was "more comprehensively anti-Semitic - both anti- Arab and anti-Jew"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: So, should there be mixed feelings in this part of the world that the trailer opens with a shot of the Empty Quarter, and continues with a very opening-of- Lawrence of Arabia shot of a young woman on a speeder bike?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Actually, no
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abu Dhabi can be confident that, even if Watto returns, commanding an entire army of Sand People against our noble heroes,(just wait for Lucas' extended version for that scene) the experience will still be net positive in terms of bringing in visitors and establishing itself further as a major film destination
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The emirate washed its hands of one Hollywood venture, and still managed to get tarred with a very unpleasant brush
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Abu Dhabi very sensibly blocked the filming of the woeful "Sex in the City 2" on its territory
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: forcing the film-makers to use Morocco instead, while still setting the action in "Abu Dhabi"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and thus
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: indelibly linking the emirate to an abysmal film memorably panned by the BBC's Mark Kermode as "consumerist pornography" and "an orgy of dripping wealth that made me want to be sick"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there will always be the argument that Star Wars is simply entertainment, and it doesn't do any favours to delve too deep into subplots and symbolism from what is essentially a kids' movie
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But it's stereotypes in mass market entertainment - and particularly in movies aimed at children - that can be most dangerous
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Disney itself has long kept its 1946 feature "Song of the South" practically under lock and key lest its dated, racist version of post-slavery American south influence today's children
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Still
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: George Lucas' fable happened a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we can hope that JJ Abram's take on the mythology will be a little more progressive in its portrayal of the fictionalised desert world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's a saga set in a desert, years after popular revolts overthrow a despotic regime, only for dark forces to emerge and fill the political vacuum
paragraphs.label: assumption
